title: Joe Biden rebounds from Ukraine scandal news to take commanding lead in Democratic primary poll
text:
Joe Biden is so far ahead of his more liberal presidential rivals that he can barely hear them shouting about income inequality and government-run health care.

The former vice president has a commanding lead in the Democratic primary race, according to a new CNN poll that gives him 34 per cent support among registered Democratic voters.

Massachusetts Sen. Elizabeth Warren and Vermont Sen. Bernie Sanders came up with 19 and 16 per cent, respectively, with their combined total barely reaching the front-runner's.

No one else in the survey reached double-digit support. South Bend, Indiana Mayor Pete Buttigieg and California Sen. Kamala Harris both scored 6 per cent support.

Joe Biden has taken a commanding lead in a new CNN poll of Democratic primary voters

The former VP appears to have rebounded from Ukraine-related scandals related to his son Hunter Biden's lucrative business dealings

Biden has gained 10 percentage points since CNN's pollsters asked the same question five weeks earlier.

He had sputtered following attacks from President Donald Trump, focusing on allegations that he helped his son Hunter Biden engage in corrupt business transactions in Ukraine and China.

Trump has accused Biden of pressuring Ukraine to fire a top prosecutor who was probing a company where Hunter Biden held a lucrative board seat. The former vice president bragged publicly last year about holding $1 billion in American loan guarantees over the Ukrainian government's head in order to get the prosecutor dismissed.

CNN's poll, released Wednesday, shows Biden with his largest lead among Democratic presidential candidates since the week he announced his campaign in late April.

He held a dominating lead at the time with 39 per cent support.

Biden, Sanders and Warren will meet later this week in South Carolina, speaking at a public forum hosted by the Bipartisan Justice Center.

Elizabeth Warren is in second place, but 15 points behind Biden – who has picked up 10 in the past 5 weeks

Bernie Sanders is running in third place; his total and Warren's combined barely reach Biden's number

Biden is also far in front of Trump in CNN's poll, beating him 53–43 in a hypothatical head-to-head matchup.

He has large polling advantages over his Democratic rivals on foreign policy, the economy, immigration and gun control.

Fifty-six per cent of Democratic voters say Biden is the best choice to manage foreign affairs, far ahead of Sanders at 13 per cent and Warren at 11 per cent.

But Sanders has closed the gap with him on health care, where Biden leads him 31–28.

Biden also runs even with Sanders on climate change, with both of them rating 26 per cent support in their party.
